New Records: Devon Conway joined a select group to make 90 or more at a World Cup
Key Match Events: Finn Allen struck a blistering 42 off just 16 balls
Mitchell Santner and Tim Southee both took three wickets each
David Warner fell for three in the second over
Mitchell Marsh was caught by Jimmy Neesham for 16
Tim David became Mitchell Santner's third wicket for 11
Pre-Game Insights: The match was a repeat of the 2021 final in Dubai where Australia powered to an eight-wicket win and maiden crown
Post-Match Reflections: Devon Conway said it was a special performance from the boys and credit has to go to Finn Allen
Aaron Finch's men now have their work cut out to match the feat in a tough Group 1
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a sold-out Sydney Cricket Ground
New Zealand got off to a sensational start after Finch sent them in to bat
Australia's chase started badly with David Warner falling for three in the second over
